_header: Lord in Thine anger up take me not / And in Thy wrath blame thou not me
Note: For other MSS which begin with an introductory stanza see 5978; for the Fifty-first Psalm separately see 3481; for st. 21 occurring separately see 6107.
Subjects: psalms, penitential; scripture texts, paraphrases; paraphrases
_description: Maydestone’s version of the Penitential Psalms — in 8-line stanzas (abababab)

BodAsh61.First Lines:
Lord in thyn Anger vp take me nouȝtAnd in thy wreth blame
                    þu not meffor certys synne hath me throuȝt souȝtThat I
                    wer laste nere helpe of the …
BodAsh61.Last Lines:
…In heuen kyndom to haue sesynAll myȝhty god in persons
                    three
BodAsh61.Editions:
Adler,  Guido,  and  M. Kaluza.  
             “über die Richard Rolle de Hampole zugeschriebene Paraphrase der
                sieben Busspsalmen.” 
             Englische Studien
         10 (1887): 215-55: 232.
Shuffleton,  George. 
             Ashmole 61: A Compilation of Popular Middle English Verse.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008: 279-10; 532-9; 615-19.

BodDig102.First Lines:
Lord in þyn angur vbbraide me nouȝtAnd in þy wratthe
                    þou blame not me…
BodDig102.Last Lines:
…Into heuene kyngdom me resseyuenThis graunte me god in
                    persones þre

BodDou232.First Lines:
Lord in þin angre vnder take me nowȝtAnd in thy welthe
                    blame þou nowȝt me…
BodDou232.Last Lines:
…In heuyn kyngdom me to cesynThis graunt o god & personis
                    thre Amen Amen etc

BodEngPoete17.First Lines:
…[ ]eng[ ] I þouge hit sweteTo suffere sorwe &
                    stormes strongffor siþen Adam þe lawe lote…
BodEngPoete17.Last Lines:
…[ ] shal seen and goostly knowen[ ] owen ordys in [ ]
                    …
BodEngPoete17.Note:
Fragment of two bifolia, the inner one complete, the outer one with most
                    of top half torn away, in a notebook of Elizabeth Barrett Browning. Six complete
                    and two partial lines on f. 9; same on f. 9v; 22 lines on each of
                        10-11v; first parts of 9 lies on f. 12; ends of 9 lines on
                        12v.

BLAdd11306.First Lines:
…þyn angyr up take me nawȝtNe in þy wrethe
                    blame nawȝt me…
BLAdd11306.Last Lines:
…In heuene kyngdom me to sesynÞis graunte god in persons
                    þre
BLAdd11306.Note:
Damaged, with partial loss of lines at beginning of text. Manuscript is
                    paginated.

BLAdd36523.First Lines:
Lord in þin anger vptake me noghtNy in þi wrath blame
                    þu not me…
BLAdd36523.Last Lines:
…At þin ryght hand make my seteÞis grace me graunte
                    oon god and persones thre

BLAdd39574.First Lines:
Lord in þi anger vptake me noghtIn thy wreth blame þow
                    not me…
BLAdd39574.Last Lines:
…In to þe kingdom of heuene me resseyuenÞus graunte
                    me god in persoonys þre
BLAdd39574.Note:
Each stanza preceded by scripture it translates, e.g. first is
                        ‘DOmine ne in furore tuo arguas me neque in ira tua corripias
                        me’.
BLAdd39574.Editions:
Day,  Mabel,
                        ed.  
             The Wheatley Manuscript: Middle English Verse and Prose in British
                Museum MS. Additional 39574.
EETS
         o.s. 155 (1921; repr. 1971): 20-59.

BLHar3810.First Lines: Lord in þyn anger vptake me nouȝt& in þy wraþ blame not me…
BLHar3810.Last Lines: …In heven kyndam me to sesenþis grant me god in personys þre

BLRoy17Cxvii.First Lines:
Lord in þin anger vpbrayd me noghtAnd in þi wreth blame
                    þou noght meffor certys syn has me thurgh soghtÞat I ware
                    lost warne helpe of þe…
BLRoy17Cxvii.Last Lines:
…And graunte vs grace we be not losteOwte of þis warld
                    wen we sal wendeAmen Amen par charite amen
BLRoy17Cxvii.Note: The text is faded (from damp?) throughout.
BLRoy17Cxvii.Attributed Title: Domine ne in furore tuo arguas me (f. 83ra)

Longleat30.First Lines:
Lord in thin argure [sic] vptake me nouȝtAnd in þi
                    wrath blame þou nouȝt me…
Longleat30.Last Lines:
…In heuen kyngdom me to lesenGraunt god in persones thre
                    Amen
Longleat30.Note:
With Rubric Latin texts at head of each stanza, the first beginning
                        ‘Domine ne in furore tuo arguas me….’
Longleat30.Attributed Title: Here begynneth þe seuen psalmis in englys (f. 26)

TCD156.First Lines:
Lord in þyn angire vndirtake me noȝtAnd in þyn
                    wrathe blame þu noȝt me…
TCD156.Last Lines:
…& lumen oculorum meorum & ipsum non est
                    mecumMy hert in me I trowblilyt it is
TCD156.Note:
Domine ne in furore tuo arguas me / neck in ira tua corripias me
                    just above, and Latin lines throughout; ends imperfectly.
TCD156.Editions:
Ellis,  Frederick Startridge,
                        ed.  
             Psalmi Penitentiales.
         Hammersmith: Kelmscott Press, 1894.

PierpontM99.First Lines:
Lord yn þin anger vptake me nouȝtAnd in þi wraþ
                    blame þu nouȝt me…
PierpontM99.Last Lines:
…Þu heuene kyndom me to seysynÞis graunte god yn
                    persones þre
PierpontM99.Note:
Passages of Latin prose precede each 8-line stanza of English which
                    translate them, beg. before first verse, ‘Domine ne in furore tuo arguas
                    me….’
PierpontM99.Editions:
Ellis,  Frederick Startridge,
                        ed.  
             Psalmi Penitentiales.
         Hammersmith: Kelmscott Press, 1894.

HunHM142.First Lines:
Lord in thyn argure [sic] uptake me noughtAnd in þi
                    wraþ blame þou not me…
HunHM142.Last Lines:
…In heuen kyngdom me to sesenGraunt god in persones
                    thre
HunHM142.Note:
With Rubric Latin texts at head of each stanza, the first beg.,
                        ‘Domine ne in furore tuo arguas me….’
HunHM142.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth þe vii psalmis in englisse (f.
                    22v)
